On Thu, 11 Jul 2002, Ken Gentle <j.kenneth.gentle@...> wrote:

> IIRC, 'optional.jar' has to be placed in ${ANT_HOME}/lib

This is an option, yes.

Basically, optional.jar must be in the same part of the classpath as
junit.jar.  Either both at CLASSPATH or none of them.

> I think this has to do with ant's custom classloading

<http://jakarta.apache.org/ant/manual/OptionalTasks/junit.html> after
the second *Note* - and if you want the full story
<http://jakarta.apache.org/ant/faq.html#delegating-classloader>.

> Placing it in the Classpath prior to invoking Ant may not have the
> desired result.

Placing it in CLASSPATH is equivalent to placing it in ANT_HOME/lib.

Stefan
